results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.

results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmproduktion, NV Polygrams S A, Peter Bennett-Jones, Eric Fellner, Tim Evans and Mel Smith
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.

results.title: Beak out
results.brief_description: A quietly humurous 3D computer animation set in the quiet after hours of a flightless bird museum. The stationary bird exhibits slowly come to life. One skeleton in waking, a pre-historic flightless bird, dreams of flying and is by ironic twist of fate, flung across the room to land on an aeroplane model. His flight, ironically, is short lived when both the flightless bird and the airplane crash together to the ground.

results.title: Beacon of light
results.brief_description: Melanie despised the fact that she came from an artistic family but eventually through their support and determination she would learn to love the world of art and indeed become part of this world she once so strongly rejected.

results.title: Beachworm! [the art of beachworming]
results.brief_description: Successful fishing is dependent on good bait and beach worms are one of the finest bait around. Professional wormer, Dan Fuller, meets presenter John Stewart on the Gold Coast and gives him the low down on day and night worming, covering aspects such as locating pippies for the berley, the mechanics of how to pull worms from the sand, place it on the hook, what sort of fish your likely to find on the end of the line, storage, legal limits and the dangers of night worming. Bloopers follow the final credits.

results.title: Beaches and boats
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren, Western Australian Government Film Unit and Leith Goodall
results.brief_description: This film depicts the beauty of Western Australia’s beaches and the lifestyle that can be enjoyed there. Sandy beaches stretch along the West Australian coast for hundreds of miles, providing an ideal place for a holiday of boating, water-skiing, surfboard riding, and sunbathing.

results.title: Beaches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Margaret Jennings South, Bette Midler, Bonnie Bruckheimer, Touchstone Pictures, Silver Screen Partners IV, Bruckheimer, South and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: The chance meeting of two young girls from totally different backgrounds becomes the friendship of a lifetime. As they lead their separate lives, they come to realise and later rely on the strength that their friendship provides. Cast includes Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey and John Heard.
